briefdescription.para: State indicator for a neighbor that has been changed.
State indicator for a neighbor that has been invalidated.
State indicator for a neighbor that has become newly available.

memberdef.argsstring: )(vrna_fold_compound_t *fc, vrna_move_t neighbor, unsigned int state, void *data)

parameterdescription.para: The fold compound the calling function is working on
The move that generates the (changed or new) neighbor
The state of the neighbor (move) as supplied by argument neighbor
Some arbitrary data pointer as passed to vrna_move_neighbor_diff_cb()

memberdef.name: vrna_loopidx_update

briefdescription.para: Alters the loopIndices array that was constructed with vrna_loopidx_from_ptable().

detaileddescription.para: The loopIndex of the current move will be inserted. The correctness of the input will not be checked because the speed should be optimized.

parameterdescription.para: The loop index data structure that needs an update
A pair table on which the move will be executed
The length of the structure
The move that is applied to the current structure

briefdescription.para: Generate neighbors of a secondary structure.

detaileddescription.para: This function allows one to generate all structural neighbors (according to a particular move set) of an RNA secondary structure. The neighborhood is then returned as a list of transitions / moves required to transform the current structure into the actual neighbor.

simplesect.para: vrna_neighbors_successive(), vrna_move_apply(), VRNA_MOVESET_INSERTION, VRNA_MOVESET_DELETION, VRNA_MOVESET_SHIFT, VRNA_MOVESET_DEFAULT

parameterdescription.para: A vrna_fold_compound_t containing the energy parameters and model details
The pair table representation of the structure
Options to modify the behavior of this function, e.g. available move set

simplesect.para: Neighbors as a list of moves / transitions (the last element in the list has both of its fields set to 0)

parblock.para: This function is attached as an overloaded method neighbors() to objects of type fold_compound. The optional parameter options defaults to VRNA_MOVESET_DEFAULT if it is omitted. See, e.g. embed:rst:inline:py:meth:`RNA.fold_compound.neighbors()` in the :doc:`/api_python`.

memberdef.argsstring: (const vrna_fold_compound_t *fc, const vrna_move_t *curr_move, const short *prev_pt, const vrna_move_t *prev_neighbors, int size_prev_neighbors, int *size_neighbors, unsigned int options)
memberdef.name: vrna_neighbors_successive

briefdescription.para: Generate neighbors of a secondary structure (the fast way)

detaileddescription.para: This function implements a fast way to generate all neighbors of a secondary structure that results from successive applications of individual moves. The speed-up results from updating an already known list of valid neighbors before the individual move towards the current structure took place. In essence, this function removes neighbors that are not accessible anymore and inserts neighbors emerging after a move took place.

simplesect.para: vrna_neighbors(), vrna_move_apply(), VRNA_MOVESET_INSERTION, VRNA_MOVESET_DELETION, VRNA_MOVESET_SHIFT, VRNA_MOVESET_DEFAULT

parameterdescription.para: A vrna_fold_compound_t containing the energy parameters and model details
The move that was/will be applied to prev_pt
A pair table representation of the structure before curr_move is/was applied
The list of neighbors of prev_pt
The size of prev_neighbors, i.e. the lists length
A pointer to store the size / length of the new neighbor list
Options to modify the behavior of this function, e.g. available move set

simplesect.para: Neighbors as a list of moves / transitions (the last element in the list has both of its fields set to 0)

memberdef.argsstring: (vrna_fold_compound_t *fc, short *ptable, vrna_move_t move, vrna_move_update_f cb, void *data, unsigned int options)
memberdef.name: vrna_move_neighbor_diff_cb

briefdescription.para: Apply a move to a secondary structure and indicate which neighbors have changed consequentially.

detaileddescription.para:
This function applies a move to a secondary structure and explores the local neighborhood of the affected loop. Any changes to previously compatible neighbors that have been affected by this loop will be reported through a callback function. In particular, any of the three cases might appear:
A previously available neighbor move has changed, usually the free energy change of the move (VRNA_NEIGHBOR_CHANGE)
A previously available neighbor move became invalid (VRNA_NEIGHBOR_INVALID)
A new neighbor move becomes available (VRNA_NEIGHBOR_NEW)

parameterdescription.para: A fold compound for the RNA sequence(s) that this function operates on
The current structure as pair table
The move to apply
The address of the callback function that is passed the neighborhood changes
An arbitrary data pointer that will be passed through to the callback function cb
Options to modify the behavior of this function, .e.g available move set

memberdef.argsstring: (vrna_fold_compound_t *fc, short *ptable, vrna_move_t move, vrna_move_t **invalid_moves, unsigned int options)
memberdef.name: vrna_move_neighbor_diff

briefdescription.para: Apply a move to a secondary structure and indicate which neighbors have changed consequentially.

detaileddescription.para: Similar to vrna_move_neighbor_diff_cb(), this function applies a move to a secondary structure and reports back the neighbors of the current structure become affected by this move. Instead of executing a callback for each of the affected neighbors, this function compiles two lists of neighbor moves, one that is returned and consists of all moves that are novel or may have changed in energy, and a second, invalid_moves, that consists of all the neighbor moves that become invalid, respectively.

parameterdescription.para: A fold compound for the RNA sequence(s) that this function operates on
The current structure as pair table
The move to apply
The address of a move list where the function stores those moves that become invalid
Options to modify the behavior of this function, .e.g available move set

simplesect.para: A list of moves that might have changed in energy or are novel compared to the structure before application of the move

briefdescription.para: Methods to compute the neighbors of an RNA secondary structure.
